net.sourceforge.waters.model.base
Class DocumentManager

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.waters.model.base.DocumentManager
public class DocumentManager
extends Object

A helper class to access and store the contents of documents obtained from XML files.

A document manager is a cache that can parse the contents of multiple documents from XML files, and provide easy access to them by their file names. The object structures loaded are called documents and all implement the DocumentProxy interface. Once loaded, they are stored in the cache, so they can be quickly retrieved when needed a second time.

After creation of a document manager, it must be provided with the appropriate proxy marshaller for each class of documents to be handled. For example:

   final DocumentManager manager = new DocumentManager();
   final ProxyMarshaller m1 = new ProductDESMarshaller();
   final ProxyMarshaller m2 = new ModuleMarshaller();
   manager.register(m1);
   manager.register(m2);
   final File file = new File("myfile.wmod");
   final ModuleProxy module = (ModuleProxy) manager.load(file);

Author:
Robi Malik

Constructor Detail

DocumentManager

public DocumentManager()
Create a new document manager. Initially, the document manager will not support marshalling or unmarshalling of any file types. To be useful, some ProxyMarshaller objects need to be registered using the register() method.

Method Detail

load

public DocumentProxy load(File path,
                          String name,
                          Class clazz)
                   throws Exception
Load a document. This methods loads a document with a given name and location, automatically computing the file extension from the expected class.

Parameters:
path - The directory containing the file to be loaded.
name - The name of the file without extension. The extension is determined automatically using a ProxyMarshaller.
clazz - The desired class of the document to be loaded. This is used to identify an appropriate ProxyMarshaller.
Returns:
The loaded document. This may just a cached copy, or it may actually be retrieved by reading an external file.
Throws:
JAXBException - to indicate that the process of reading or parsing an XML file has failed.
ModelException - to indicate that a parsed XML structure could not be converted to Waters objects due to serious semantic inconsistencies.
IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyMarshaller for the given class was found.
Exception

load

public DocumentProxy load(File filename)
                   throws Exception
Load a document. This methods loads a document from a given file name, guessing the expected class from the file name extension.

Parameters:
filename - The complete path name identifying the file to be loaded.
Returns:
The loaded document. This may just a cached copy, or it may actually be retrieved by reading an external file.
Throws:
JAXBException - to indicate that the process of reading or parsing an XML file has failed.
ModelException - to indicate that a parsed XML structure could not be converted to Waters objects due to serious semantic inconsistencies.
Exception

register

public void register(ProxyMarshaller marshaller)
Registers a proxy marshaller. This method adds the given marshaller object with this document manager, so future calls to the load() method can use it to load documents of the type supported by it.

Parameters:
marshaller - The proxy marshaller to be registered.

findProxyMarshaller

public ProxyMarshaller findProxyMarshaller(Class clazz)
Gets the marshaller used to marshal objects of a given class.

Parameters:
clazz - The class of objects to be looked up.
Returns:
The ProxyMarshaller used by this document manager to handle objects of the given class.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyMarshaller for the given class was found.
